text: on tap dark reddish pink color off white quick fading head aroma is tart cranberry and wood taste is well balanced between sour and sweet
Bottle. Cloudy amber pour with a small white head. Aroma is caramel apple and cranberry, really nice. Taste is lightly tart, cranberry and caramel. Delicious and nicely balanced.
Bardzo intensywne owoce, żurawina i borówki na pierwszym planie, sporo lacto, delikatne bretty, cierpki finisz.
Butelka z 2016, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Fajnie owocowe, bardzo ciekawy balans słodyczy i kwaśności. Bardzo smaczne.
[2/5/17] Bottle at Amits place in Poughkeepsie. Thanks Amit. 2016 bottle. Nice red. Aroma of jammy berries. Sweet and tart berries flavor.

Got in a trade with The-Adjunct-Hippie. 12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/15/2016. Pours slightly hazy reddish/pinkish/orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky light pink head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big tart/tangy cranberry, raspberry, cherry, lemon, green apple, red grape, hay, straw, grass, pepper, oak, wheat, cracker, light leathery funk/vanilla, and yeast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of cranberries, fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/tangy cranberry, raspberry, cherry, lemon, green apple, red grape, hay, straw, grass, pepper, oak, wheat, cracker, light leathery funk/vanilla, and yeast/oak earthiness. Moderate fruity/lactic tartness and light yeast/tannic oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart/tangy cranberry, raspberry, cherry, lemon, green apple, red grape, hay, straw, grass, pepper, wheat, cracker, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; with an amazing malt/tartness balance, and zero astringent/puckering flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/dry, acidic/creamy/grainy, and lightly tannic mouthfeel that is insane. Absolutely perfectly balanced. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6%. Overall this is an insane fruited sour ale! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of cranberries, fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the modest acidity. Absolutely perfectly balanced flavors with incredible complexity. A highly amazing offering.

Thanks Virby44 for the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing moderately filtered cranberry red with a finger and a half of cranberry tinged white foam. 

The nose shows a tart cranberry notes with strong steel tank notes. 

The palate is light bodied and highly carbonated. Flavors of strong cranberry with a light sweetness and moderate tartness. Not puckering - well balanced flavors all around and fruit forward enough to keep it interesting. Maybe a bit too sweet for the style but the sweetness feels natural coming from the cranberries.

Red pink pour with a nice lasting pale pink head. A good bit of lacing. Aroma is sweet berries, wood, earthy, and some funk. Taste is tart cranberry, berry candy, wood, earthy, and funk. Nice balance between tartness and sweetness. Light acidity. Light body. Really nice beer.

Bright fruity doughy aroma. Opaque pastel pink with a light pink fuzzy head that fizzles down to a thin off white film on the top of the beer. Sweet and tart. A little puckery. Lots of cran. Starts off smooth and then it's got that back of the jaw tightening feel on the finish. This is really good.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a murky red with white head. Aroma is big time cranberries. Taste is moderately to heavily tart but not a lot of sourness. Huge cranberry flavor. Gives you a pucker on the finish. Tastes like fresh cranberries and not artificial. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From Bushel and Peck. The genius of NG is restraint, bold flavors but everything in its measure, not too fruity and sweet not too tart. Excellent. Serving: Bottle

12-oz bottle from woodmans-food Madison West. beautiful clear raspberry soda color, foamy slightly pink head, some lace, fruity malty nose, super fruity, even tart like cranberries! full body, a winner.

Sour red fruits, cranberry, cherry.Hazy red, small, creamy, reddish, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Some sours coming up, sweet, red fruits, Some sweets remaining, sour, dry finish. Nice Fruit Beer, not quite as high up at the other ones.

12 ounce bottle from Woodmans in Beloit, WI (July 2016) sampled cold from the refrigerator in a New Glarus flute. Pours a fine-bubbled translucent dark pink with largish fizzy diminishing head, fine lacing; looks sort of like watermelon juice or I suppose watery cranberry juice....nose is prominently tart/sour/funky, with fresh fruit aroma there, but subdued, along with a little dry honey and thyme...while the aroma is perhaps a little more lambic or sour, I think the designation as a fruit beer will show to be correct to most people when they get to tasting, as the sweet-and-sour cranberry dominates from the start, with an initial lightly honeyish sweetness fading rapidly as a huge tartness comes in to finish, with a light white wine character intruding upon the nasal passages as the beer slips down the throat, and a touch of pepper lingering...strong carbonation, juicy, medium-bodied mouthfeel. For me this is not quite on par with this brewerys best fruit beers, but it is pretty special in its own right, and the finishing mixture of huge tartness, white wine dryness, and peppery spiciness is really something quite wonderful. This is my second four-pack and Ill likely get a couple more; most of their fruit beers age quite well and interestingly, and this is likely no exception.

12 oz bottle I got as a extra for proxying a trade for Brian. Shared with ebone1988. 2016 vintage. The pour is a darker ruby color, lightly foggy, with a light pinkish head that falls to a collar leaving a good bit of aoapynlace behind. The aroma is interesting. There is a soft cranberry and a nice tart sourness. The fruit is nice and juicy and the tartness light and crisp. The flavor is really sweet. I was hoping for something that was a lot more tart. The cranberry is definitely there and in high volume, but its too sweet. The tartness really is relaxed, and this is almost like a sugar-heavy juice. The mouth feel is lighter and pretty syrupy. The carbonation is light and a little softer. The aftertaste is definitely sweet cranberry, and carries a little tartness. Its an interesting beer for sure.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is cranberries, bitter, slight sour, skins, great. Appearance is red, off white light pink head, somewhat clear. Taste is cranberry, bitter, skins, slightly tart, really good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, wonderful dry cranberry aftertaste. Overall, New Glarus knows their way around a fruit beer.

Bottle poured in tulip. Deep reddish pink. Light pink head that dissipates rather quick to a thin ring. Smells of tart cranberries and faint funk. Grass, old danky wood. That dry lambic smell you love. Tastes of mild sour cranberries and starts out semi sweet from the fruit but balances out to be quite dry as it finishes. Mouth puckering at the end but just enough. Could be more sour but that's just me. Medium to high carbonation and light body. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear pink pour with a single finger pinkish hued head. Aroma is grassy and hay like. A hint of fruit, smells dry. Lots of carbonation, medium bodied. Lace present. Tart cranberries with a hint of sweetness. Finishes dry and leaves you wanting another drink. Very good.

Bottle. Sweet tart lactic cranberry/lemon aroma. Hazy deep rose with a moderate pastel pink head. Sweet tart, slightly musty lactic berry/lemon flavor. Body on the lighter side of medium, moderate carbonation. Phenomenal!

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 2016 Vintage... Fruity aroma, but nothing distinct along with hints of red wine and vinegar; pinky-mauve color with a lilac colored head; a bit sweet at first and then quickly moves to tart and dry and full of fresh, tart cranberries, nice dryness in the finish, slightly puckering; light medium body, well carbonated; excellent cranberry beer, very flavorful and refreshing, great lambic without being too acidic. 12 fl oz bottle.

APPEARANCE-dark pink whispy pure white head with minimal lacing. 
NOSE-slightly sour, hints of cranberry (you guessed it).
FLAVOR- perfect tartness which is followed by a nice, surprisingly sweet, cranberry flavor. 
NOTES- couldnt be more pleased with this beer.
From a 12 oz bottle purchased at the brewery. Pours a clear rose with an off white head. Fruity plasticine nose. Flavors are sweet with tart cherry notes. Dry finish.
Bottle. Pours a clear reddish color. Aroma and taste are sweet and tart cranberries.
Bottle from brewery, delicious. Pretty red pink color. Balanced fruity sweetness, cranberry, and tart. Light, effervescent. Excellent.

Thanks Dan for the bottle. This beer rocks. Pours a beautiful pinkish ruby red with a light pink head. Aromas of cranberry juice with a slight hint of funk. So refreshing. Like drinking juice on a joy July 4th day.
I am such a sucker for these. Bright pink. Aroma is fruity, cranberry and some apple. Slightly tart, with a bitter cranberry finish. Could drink too many of these
Excellent tart fruit beer. Pours crimson with minimal head. Nothing special in the aroma category, but excellent drinkable tart flavor.

Draft. Pours reddish-pick with light pink head and lacing. Fruit and cranberry aroma. Sweet fruit upfront followed by tart cranberries in the long, effervescent finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Orange with white head. Poured from 12oz bottle at home. Very fruity of course. Not sure cranberry is what I taste, but it is very good whatever it is. Not too sweet either

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to nofunsally. Pours pale yellow with a little to no white head. Aroma is unripe apples, cranberries, honey, lemon and sour grapes. Flavour is sweet, light bitter and light sour. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is dry, light sour and sweet, lots of cranberries and apples.

12 oz. bottle, from my Secret Santa! Shared at my going away cellar clearing party. Pours a clear bronze color, with no real head. The nose is cranberries (no really, lots of cranberries), apple, and cardamom. Sweet and fruity flavor, with a light tartness. Light body, slighly acidic, crisp, syrupy, and clean. This is a very nice, balanced, fruity beer, but in a complex and delicious way.
just really not a fan of the thumbprint series. none of them have wowed me and this one is pretty much the same.

bottle shared with tracey...thank you honey...poured a lighter pinkish orange color with minimal white head. aroma is mildly sour and cranberry. the flavor is off the chart...very nice cranberry and sour mix that is so delicious. mild acidic. omg this is fruity good. absolutely one of the best mild sours I have ever had.
This is my first new glarus beer, got it in a trade. Im not a huge fan of cranberry so my opinion on this isnt the one you should follow if you do like cranberry.

Honey colored pour with short lived head. Tart nose of mainly fruit. Taste is like a sweet tart with cranberry and other fruit on the front end and a crisp tartness on the back. Very well balanced. Very good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, pink Amber, big white head didnt last. Aroma cider vineagar, faintly funky, and fruit, some lemon. Taste is apples and salt, some spice, maybe cranberry? Palate is light, carbonation fine. Finish is sweet and sour. Pretty nice! Drinking before dinner.

Bottle split at Bruces pad - for the last time, thanks to that Manny G, 27/03/15. 
Hazed orange golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is sweet berry fruits, light acidic smoke, tangy citrics, sugary notes.
Taste comprises sweet fruits, light spice, bitter orange, faint wood, sugars, raspberry jelly.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a mixture of sweet and light acidic notes.
So so fruit pap - not quite sure what all the fuss is with this one!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle share, thanks to Padraig. Hazy amber orange, lightly sparkling, small ring of white head. Aroma is lemon, grape, musty. Body is medium, foamy, tingly carbonation. Taste is very sweet toffee, boiled sweets, jammy fruit, dry metallics, finishes dry. A bit on the sweet side for me.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Ladraig. Pours clear yellow-gold with a creamy white head. Jammy fruits on the nose, some white grape, berries. Medium sweet flavor with some pickle juice, lemon, more grapes. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Warming finish with strong acidity, more grapes, lemon, orange. Interesting stuff. Salty, sweet, sour. Novel.
12oz to tulip. Pours a reddish orange with a thin white head. Aroma is tart, lactic acid, and cranberry juice. Taste is sweet, tart, berries, with an aftertaste of cranberry juice. Thanks Tom
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 12oz bottle. Pours bright red with minimal head. Strong sour tart aroma. Awesome tart cranberry flavor with clean finish. Another awesome brew from New Glarus!

Pours a clear red tinged golden with a nice off white head of foam with fine bubbles, that settles to a film and leaves great lacing. Aroma of cranberries, wood and some tartness. Taste has some sweetness mixed with some cider vinegar sourness. Flavors of cranberries, grape skins, wood and hint of vanilla. The sweetness fades and the sourness and wood linger into the aftertaste and finish. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium/full body and effervescent carbonation. Very well blended and balanced flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tastes like tart apple juice with a very tiny amount of funk. Has a good flavor, though like most New Glarus fruit beers, it tastes like juice.

Bottle, thanks to northernbrews. Reddish-amber with a small head that fades to a very thin ring. Aroma seems more like strawberry and raspberry than cranberry and its awesome. Some leather and vanilla mixed in the with fruit. Finally get the cranberry in the taste. So much sweet fruit juice but the light to moderate tartness balances great. Some dry leather and light funk. Love this. Almost as good as their big bottle fruit beers but a much cheaper price.

12oz bottle in a teku. Pours ruby/amber with an off-white head. Aroma of cranberries, some sourness, light malts, hints of oak and funk, and some sweetness. Flavor the same with a nice berry note that blends well with the pretty sweet yet sour beer. Average texture with nice carbonation. A solid beer.

Cranberry/ tart fruit, sweet and sour aroma. Bright light pink appearance with minimal head and lacing. Sweet upfront and finishes highly acidic/ tart that lingers. The overall taste is simple and straightforward. Higher carbonation results in an effervescent light mouthfeel. Overall one of my favorites from New Glarus simple and balanced showcasing how well cranberries work with a lanbic culture.
12oz bottle. Rich Amber color, not much aroma but tasted delicious. Wish i had more bottles.

Picked up a couple of 4 packs while in Wisconsin. Once again, New Glarus does not disappoint, especially when it comes to fruit beers. This cran-bic is very good. Almost a champaign mouth feel with the nice tartness of cranberries. I hope this limited release makes a return to shelves again.
Wow. Incredible. Has NG written all over it. Reddish amber. Lasting white head. Great sourness. Wonderful amazing sourness! !some tartness. Fruitiness - cherry, cranberry. Phenomenal.

12oz bottle shared with a few friends. Poured a slightly ruby amber color with a small pink(?) head. Aroma was tart cranberries, sweet light fruit notes. Some light tartness, akin to a lambic, but not too tart. Light funky notes, a bit like cranberries and some light wild strawberries.

Bottle given to me by a friend. Clear gold to amber pour with a thick white head; lots of carbonation. Aroma of funk, lacto and sour fruit. Tart flavor hits the tongue the same time as sweet fruit before a sour lacto finish. Incredible and I still have one left!

12 ounce bottle from Timfoolery, tart, sweet, extremely fruity, pale pink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

December 28, 2014 - bottle purchased at a small store in Wisconsin. Clear orangish pour with limited head. Aroma was sour fruit and a little bit of sweetness. Taste was like a sparkling fruit juice that was balanced nicely with some sourness.
Rose gold pour with a white head. Cranberry and funk aroma. Sour, acidic taste with tart cranberry and lemon.
12 oz bottle. Wow this was great. Nose had some cranberry and funk to it. Taste was of cranberry, tartness. Had almost soda like carbonation.
Bottle from adnielsen. Pours a ruby orange color with white head. Cranberry, slight sour aromas. Sour, somewhat plasticy, fruity berry flavors.
Pours a clear lighter golden color with white colored head, light and fizzy. Some funk, cranberries, wheat, and oak on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry.
Bottle. Color is red/pink with solid off white head. aroma of tart cranberry and tangy lemon. taste is sweet and sour i love it.

Bottle  on Thanksgiving of course. Pours a clear pale orange-pink with no head, almost like a rosé. Aroma is tart strawberries and raspberries, light cranberry, orange, lemon zest, minerals and acidity. Taste is sweet and sour, slightly soda-like, like cranberry Sprite and sour white wine with crushed raspberries and faint oak. Lemon juice and yogurt on the finish. Slight acid burn. Tasty, but quite sweet and lacking the depth of many other New Glarus offerings.

November 2, 2014. Bottle at home, bottled august 22, 2014. 
Clear pale reddish with a small, quickly dissipating, white head. Aroma is sweet berries, light tart dry cranberries, citrus, light funky notes. Taste is medium tart and medium sweet fruity with cranberries, citrus and light earth. Finish is lasting dry tart cranberries. Medium bodied, soft carbonation.

Bottle thanks to homer321, shared at our annual faux-giving. Clear amber ("apple juice") pour with ring of fine bubbles. Aroma goes all out on cranberry. Sweet-tart. Taste is more sweet than tart with underlying funk. Palate: medium body, slick almost syrupy texture, soft carbonation. Overall: a delight, a hit with everybody.
Bottle tnx to angst. Pours clear pale red. Aroma is funky dryish berry. Sweet sour funky berry cranberries.

Bottle received in trade. Pours reddish pink with a small pinkish offwhite head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and tiny funky with cranberries, lemon juice, dry soil, minerals and hint of barnyard. Taste is sweet, sour and fruity with crackers, cranberries, lemonade, brown sugar, hay, dry soil, minerals and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is tiny dry, tart, astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, sour and fruity with crackers, lemon juice, cranberries, green apples, hay, dry soil and lemon zest. Tasty nicely balanced cranberry bomb!

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 11-10-14. Tart, floral, fruity, funky, mineral, strong aroma. Pours a clear, bright, sparkling pink or dark salmon color. Looks like a rose sparkling wine. Small amount of beige head. Produces some lacing. Very cool appearance. Sour, tart, citric taste features a citrus soda flavor. Quite flavorful. Cranberry and cranberry juice. Very tart. There is a fructose sweetness, but the tartness dominates the sweetness. Red wine-like taste. Herbal finish. Lively and biting in the palate. Light to medium body. Overall, Cran-bic is a really nice beer, another winning fruit beer from New Glarus. Its not quite as overwhelmingly awesome as the even more fruit-heavy Belgian Red, Raspberry Tart, and Serendipity, but it is still very, very good.
Bottle at Craigs...nose is vinegar and plasticine and sour funk...balsamic vinegar and apple...peach linger
Bottle. Golden with a pinkish hue. Aroma is very funky, some vinegar. Tatse of funk, vinegar, fruit. Nice sweet and sour balance.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear red amber with a thin head. Aromas of sour funk, vinegar, cranberry. Taste is chalky, light sour. Finishes light fruit, sour, good.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale amber, nose is funky cranberry, taste is dry, sour, fruity cranberry, light spice.

Another solid beer from New Glarus. Their mastery of fruitiness and sourness reaches a rarely seen subtly in this one. Light pink and toeing the delicate balance between slightly sweet and slightly sour. Courtesy of Josh at my b-day party.
Poured an oranges color with aromas of dry cranberries, light malt and some tartness. Flavors match the aromas with tart cranberries and some light tartness. Love this beer could drink this all day.

Bottle from unknown via Chris H. Pours A pale pink, little bit of head. Aroma arch, doughy, some lacto, vinous, yeast character. Not entirely appealing, to be honest. Body is full and lush, with a lingering tartness and just the right amount of sweetness. Im apparently not as head over heels about this as some, but a solid beer nonetheless.

Bottle (12 oz). From Rich, thanks! Hazy golden/orange with a small quickly disappearing white head and almost no lacing. Aroma is of cranberries, oak, vanilla, light sweetness and light spiciness. Taste is a nice mix of sweet and sour with cranberries, an important wood presence and light spiciness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Cranberries sourness finish. Quite tasty and easy drinking despite the moderate sourness. Interesting balance. Not the most complex brew.

355ml bottle as an extra from elytsdlo - thanks again dude! Epic extra! This pours rose with no head. Aroma is strong cranberries and damp hay bales. Cranberries are prevalent in the taste which follows into a sweetishly sour experience.
Aroma is cranberries, sourness and slightly sour . The flavor is cranberries, medium sweetness, malts and a sour/very tart finish.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 12oz bottle as a bonus from chebyshev. Clear copper with a slight red hue, light white head at first but it completely disappears - lovely colour though. Cranberry, oak, tart, high carbonation, moderate body, huge cranberry tartness on the palate with some yeast, funk, hint of milkiness, and oak on the finish that create a lovely sensation on the palate. Mmmmmm.
12oz bottle-thanks Rego. Thin white-amber. A-cranberry/tart, wood. T-cranberry/tart, spice, wood, sweet med malt.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 2014 bottle: Weird ticklish carbonation that gets much better if you let it sit overnight in the fridge. Sour cranberry smell with an almost vinegar-like note to it. Taste is mostly the same. The vinegar note is present in the aftertaste along with a strange warmth.  Original Thumbprint Release:  Carbonation is much better (for a sour) and the taste is more focused on the sourness than the new 2014 release.  Taste is an 8 and palate is a 4 on the original Thumbprint release whereas the newer one is a 6 on taste and a 2 on palate, so I?ll do an average of the two for this rating.

bottle shared with hakes and wit-wickers at club w.. clear red pour with thin white head, aroa is bandaid and sour fruit, taste is BOOM IN YO FACE cranberry sweet/sour, strong first drink , but good, . normally not my style, but I dig it

12oz bottle pours a clear red copper with very small head and no lacing. Aromas of cranberries and Belgian yeast. Flavor is an amazing punch in the face tart cranberry with clean crisp finish. Delicious!
Im not even a huge cranberry guy, but this is good. Tart but sweet and great fruit profile with the sourness. Well balanced, especially for a cranberry beer.

Bottle as a trade extra, labeled as Unplugged, not Thumbprint, so unsure if the year. Pours murky amber color with a small white to off white head into my Cantillon taster. Aroma of toffee, caramel, oak, even some chocolate, along with the expected cranberry fruit. Smells pretty rich, not a huge lacto tartness here that I would expect from something claiming to be in the lambic style. Flavor is lots of funky cranberries, plenty of sweet caramel malt, oak, and a bit of metallic oxidation. On the sweeter side with light tartness from the fruit. Medium plus body with high prickly carbonation. Very much in the style if their big fruit beers, and less so in the lambic/wild/sour category. nevertheless, a nice little fruit beer.

Bottle pour pinkish copper with rapidly dissipating head. Nose tart funk, woody tannin. Taste tart up front followed by sweet cranberry juice. Early and then again late palate some evidence of the barrel. Finish a mix of sweet and sour. Several different layers of flavors parade past your tongue in this one.

12oz. bottle supplied by Stine over from Minnesota - many thanks! To oversized cognac snifter, it pours a peach-tinted clear goldenrod yellow with which a whitish-ringed head stood. Froth soon dissipates leaving behind a syrupy, sparkling soda-liquid liquid. Aroma of cherry-flavored cough suppressant, buttercup squash, wallpaper, poppy seeds, sun-damaged kriek lambic dregs, cranberry juice, and electrical tape. Tastes the same (save for wallpaper and electrical tape), raspberry chewable vitamins, blue agave syrup, elderberries, and dandelion petals. Alfafa blossom honey, candle wax, and, strangely, tomatoes experienced at swallow. No kidding - definitely tasted umami by its sticky finish. And in case you hadnt already guessed, thick and glutinous. As my sister, Hannah, said: "It feels like drinking mushy air." She couldnt take the flavor nor the texture of this beer, but I found it enjoyable. I wouldnt be able to drink this everyday.
Pinkish orange. Nose is cranberries, box of crayons. Taste is sweet and tart cranberries. Light sticky body.

36cl, no mention of ABV, as New Glarus Cran-bic, American brew, with cranberries, thx alot to Secret Santa!, complex sour fruit brew, sour/sweet/fruity and slightly salty/woody, yet not balanced, clear, nearly no head, nice brew, yet expensive!

12 ounce bottle. Thanks Al. Pours a clear pale red with a small off-white head. Aroma of tart fruit and berries. Taste is cranberry, tart cherry, and a touch of yeast. On the tart side of the scale. Very good.

The beer is an oddly bright coppery orange. Theres a reddish, pinkish hue to it, particularly evident on the small head. It seems to be rather clear, which I didnt expect. The aroma has a very nice sour quality. Cranberry is just a bit much, and a tiny touch of cough syrup comes out from the sweetness of the fruit. Otherwise, the beer has a very nice funky, fruity sour aroma. Very mild malt note. Light oak. The taste does not live up to the aroma for me. Its sharply acidic. Theres also too much sweetness and more of that fruit cough syrup flavoring to it. It just has a funny sweet and sour character that I dont particularly like. It tastes like someone put a funny fruit syrup in a strongly acidic but decent sour. The sharp bite and lingering sweetness drown out the initial bright fruit and funk/oak complexity. Mouthfeel is a bit sticky with a sharp vinegar acidity in the back of the throat. Just doesnt work for me.
12oz bottle. Pours clear pink, thin white head. Aroma is sour with some cranberry, taste is crisp clear sour. Perhaps some cranberry? Hard to separate from the standard sour, but tasty all the same.

"well, that was different. almost as good as Sam Adams Cranberry Lambic. Ha-made ya look! this one was actually a treat. i didnt really know what to expect here. poured a prinkish-ruby color with a small fluffy head. aroma is wild...cranberries, tons of wood, really funky and musty. feel is nice, heavily carbonated but a soft palate on the swallow. flavor is tart and sweet, soft yet assertive...more wood, sweet tart like cranberries, almost a vanilla-like overtone to it. a really really interesting beer. not an everyday drinker, but i definitely liked it.thanks again, pfoxyjohn!"

Pours a clear red tinged golden with a nice off white head of foam with fine bubbles, that settles to a film and leaves great lacing. Aroma of cranberries, wood and some tartness. Taste has some sweetness mixed with some cider vinegar sourness. Flavors of cranberries, grape skins, wood and hint of vanilla. The sweetness fades and the sourness and wood linger into the aftertaste and finish. Mouthfeel is semi creamy with a medium/full body and effervescent carbonation. Very well blended and balanced flavors.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Shared 12 oz. bottles poured to snifters, showing a fairly clear, ruby color, with a frothy layer of white head foam that diminished rather quickly to a light film & thin ring, and light spots of lacing. The aroma was expressively cran-tart and funky, as the oak & yeast combined to create what I can only respectfully describe as a peat, pasture, and piss nose. Light to medium bodied, the cranberry/cherry-like sweetness was nearly cloying, if not for the pronounced tartness, and lively carbonation. Still got my attention, in a flavorful way. Recently shared the 2016 version from 12 oz. bottles poured to snifters. Noticed more balance in the sweetness & tartness, with expressive cran-cherry notes, less "pasture" to the funkiness, and closer to medium bodied. +.3

At BBF 2014
Pours clear amber , small white head . 
Smell is plasticinne , taste is likewise . Plastic . Feels unhealthy
Bottle. Pour is hazy red/yellow with a very small white head. Aroma and flavor of cranberries, cheese, sourdough, oak, sour mix, and sugar. Finish is dry with tart cranberries and slight sourdough.

12oz bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours clear punkish orange with 2 finger head. Nose has nice musty wet oak funk and some tart crisp cranberry spritzer, pink lemonade. Taste is pretty simple, light bodied cranberry tart juice, light funk on palate, some touches of dry oaky sweet vanilla in the finish and ripe moderately tart cranberry juice linger.
Bottle thanks to Dfonorow. Poured pink orange with min head. Aroma of sweet sour acid cranberries in there. Med light carb med bod. Blunt sour taste with sweet cranberry, lil tart.

Golden-red, quite clear with a light tan head. Funky sour, berry notes. Light honey sweetness. Initially quite sour, but quickly followed by a fairly cloying sweetness. Less well balanced than some of his other fruit beers, but still very obviously in the tradition of a lambic. Medium body, quite effervescent. Pretty serious amounts of carbonation and acidity. Longish finish, never really dries out at all. Overall, quite enjoyable.
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a clear red orange with small off white head. The aroma is strong cranberry and oak. Medium mouth, jammy cranberry, nice sourness, light wood, really enjoyed this.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. 
Aroma is fruity with a nice cranberry character. Some light acidic notes with faint malt character. 
Pours a fairly clear, pinkish orange with a small, moderately thick, slightly pink head that recedes fairly quickly to a small film on top and thicker along the edges. 
Flavor has a slight sweetness balanced with a medium light acidity. Moderate cranberry notes. Juicy like other New Glarus fruit beers. Faint malt notes and low bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a very tasty, easy drinking beer, but it is not much like a lambic. Clean, acidity but not really any funkiness. Nice fruit notes.
Light pink, small white head. Aroma is quite tart, perhaps a hint of fruit. Opens quite tart, finishes pretty sweet. Too sweet for me, maybe this will get better with age.
12oz bottle pours a light pink with a small off white head. Sweet cherry and cranberry taste. Very drinkable, not sour at all.

Poured from bottle into fluted glass. Pinkish color, with nice bubbly white head. Smell is apple vinegar, nail polish, some fruit, almost wine-y. Taste is sweet and tart fruit, with maybe a little yeast, and must (I guess?). Body is medium-light, feel is kind of slick. Disclaimer: this is not my favorite style of beer. That being said, this is the best/ my favorite one that Ive had. The sweetness and sourness are balanced well, and the overall flavor is very pleasing.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 12 oz bottle, 2014 Thumbprint. Light pink, like white Zinfandel. Taste is pretty sour, somewhat sweet, berry, cranberry, cherry. Reminded me of serendipity, a bit more sour, less added sugar. Very acidic. Lots of carbonation. 9/8/14

2016 bottle.  Medium sour. Light cranberry with some other mixed berries. Medium sweetness.  Tasty and refreshing.  6/10/16

Pink color. Looks kind of like pink champaign with light carbonation. Sour fruity aroma. Very tasty. Tart cranberry fruit taste. Slight musty yeast taste. I like it a lot. Id say its like a cranberry sour beer.

Bottle via trade. Nose is tart and puckering, almost gets you in the gills. obviously some cranberry but I feel the tartness is more prominent. Pour is a haxy reddish orange with white head that dies immediately. Taste is much less funky than nose would indicate. Still has a chest hitting tartness, but subdued. Lots of fruitiness and fruit skin in the flavor. A very well played balance of fruit and tartness. A hint of warming in the chest but that could be from the sourness. Another great NG beer.

Bottle with thanks to bauermj! Pours hazy orange amber with a medium beige creamy head that lasts well and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is strong cranberry, not much else. Flavor is medium sweet, very fruity, some oak, light tartness in there as well, but its hard to tell if that is a natural product of the cranberries or from open air fermentation. Minimal acidity. Full rich body, yummy. Another winner from NG!
Nice cranberry juice flavor but not too sweet, bubbly texture like champagne, has a bit of a good yogurty lactic tartness. Not funky, but extremely tasty.

Bottle, thanks to Mr. Drake, Esq. The pours ruddy ruby with a large off-white head. Sweet bright cherry skin. Earthy and meaty. Just a touch of cranberry tang. Sugar. The taste is of strawberry fig newtons. Red apple skin. Cherry compote. Light and dry on the finish. Light body, soft carbonation. Overall, pleasant and easy. A docile, friendly companion.

Pour is dark amber with a pinkish hue and a tight white head. Nose is huge cranberry with a strong sawdust oakiness in back and notes of vanilla. Taste is tart cranberry and lots of oaky goodness. Notes of vanilla in back with an assertive carbonation on a medium body with a very soft palate.

I had this under the Unplugged series label. I had stored away a couple bottles in my cellar (the old, now disused water pump cellar behind the furnace...good and steady cool temperature) and today I ventured in there. This bottle was at least three or four years old...and boy, was it ever good. It might be at its peak right now. Theres a great Belgian sourness to it, with a cranberry flavor that is perfectly balanced by woody strains. It might be showing some signs of aging, but only in the most delightful way. If I had been given a bottle and told it came from one of the rarest and best Belgian lambic producers (other than Cantillon, because it doesnt fit their style), I would have believed it. Great beer for Thanksgiving 2013. Bottle.

A: Golden Straw/Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Some Lacing

S: Cranberry, Mild Tart Cherry, Mild Hay

T: Cranberry, Mild Tart Cherry, Mild Jolly Rancher

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Sweet

Overall, a pretty decent surprise...I was not expecting much from this but it was actually pretty good, mildly acidic but very tolerable even for the non sour palate.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Jeff! Pure and clear copper with a head that fades to a sporadic film across the top. Aroma is dusty, juicy cranberry and cranberry juice. Sweet with a mild tart presence. Taste is juicy, swift, and hefty cranberries. Such pure and gushing cranberry fruitiness. Sweet and lightly tart, juicy and so full of flavor. Good oak presence throughout as well. Carbonated cranberry juice. Could take out a six pack of this in record time.

Bottle, courtesy Brigadier, thanks! Copper pour, white head. Aroma of cranberry, strawberry. Taste is tart, sweet, cranberry, lemon, oak. Palate is slick, sweet, fruity finish. Not really funky but very enjoyable.

Wow. was expecting a different results after seeing and the positive reviews. 
The beer has a nasty almost cheese/lacto nose to it. Its a nice golden blond with an extremely light tint of pinkish red. This tastes weird as hell. Mouthfeel on this one is off too. Its way thick (the same way stouts are when you add lactose). Couldnt finish it.

Dont know when this was out. Maybe its too old. Either way, I wouldnt buy it.

12oz bottle courtesy of Todd. ROCKIN!

A: Clearish reddened copper. Theres very little head from this pour and the beer looks remarkably still. 

N: Banana, cranberry, cheese, dough, and some leather. Doesnt smell terribly tart, nor is there much oak. Plenty of funk, though. Lots of that for you to enjoy.

T: Sweet like banana and a minor level of tartness to break up the sugars. Some oak and funk lingers on this one. Has kind of a molasses-barbecue aspect.

M: Well carbonated with a lighter body. Lingers on the palate with a nice warmth.

O: A cross between the New Glarus fruit beers and a wild ale. Might be fallen off a bit, as Im not sure when this was originally brewed. I do like it and would have it again. Just expect something much sweeter and fruitier.

First beer Im rating as I drink so I will write it a real review.  Smells sour with a hint of cherries.  Amberish in color with a slight red tint, was expecting it to be a little more red in color.  Taste is amazing, awesome balance of sweet and sour.  Tastes of cranberry and cherry.  I wish I could just slam this and go get more.  Thanks to madvike for the bottle.
Bottle. Pours a great hazy red with a little head. Tons of cranberry on the nose with some tartness, flavor is similar but more sour at the end. Very solid, wish I had more!

Awesome - bottle shared by the Hoff! I have had this in the past, but never rated it. Big cranberry nose. Hazy red pour with a reddish tan head. Big cranberry flavor followed up by some nice sourness.

12 ounce bottle thanks to mashmaster. Pours a still copper with no head. Aroma has a lot of cranberry and sweet fruits. Tastes sweet and a little tart. Overall, another awesome fruit beer from New Glarus. This is a permanant want for me.

Bottle from puddintane. Pours hazy tan amber capped by an off white head. Nose of funk, cranberries and spice. Taste starts slightly puckering with hints of yeast and cranberries. Body is light, fizzy, and easy to consume in mass. My wife asked where this was from. She said she would be down for a trip. We shall see.

Bottle.  Pours an unclear dark orange with no head.  Smell is sweet and tart berries (maybe cranberry only bc it was already suggested in the title), hint of vanilla, oak.  Taste is tart cranberries, oak, sweet, caramel/vanilla undertones, funk.  Straight up good.

Pours a red orange color with a slight head to it that disappears rather quickly. Scent is mild with cranberries being the most obvious as well as yeast. Almost has the same scent as a cranberry wine! The taste of berries explode as they hit your tongue. Very strong in cranberry with some wheat and yeasts in the mix. A surprising sweet taste and yet it is just right. Not too strong and not too weak. Texture is just slightly bubbly otherwise nicely flat that brings that unique aspect to the table. Definitely something interesting to try for eclectic beer lovers!

Arôme intéressante de sirop fruité avec une touche dacidité qui augure bien. En bouche, un sirop de canneberges très sucré mais comme larôme présageait, un fini acide. La sécheresse est à point mais les sucres restent trop longtemps à mon goût.
Ruikt Fruitig en zuur, oranje, helder. Smaakt heel zoet, cranberry, fruitig, lekker...

This bottled brew from rbsg #20 poured a small sized head of frothy white colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a softly carbonated transparent light brown colored body. The mild aroma was malty and cranberry.  The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The sour flavor contained notes of cranberry and mild citrus.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle via the CheesedMan.  Thanks Daniel!  It pours a hazy, deep amber color with a fleeting, light tan head.  The nose is a musty mix of tart cranberries and earth.  The flavor has a little up front sweetness, but thats quickly balanced by a nice tart cellar character.  Lots of flavors going on with this one.  Sweat, lemon, cranberry, mineral notes, and funk.  Light to medium body with lively carbonation and a lingering finish.  Great brew.

I think I got this from Janderson91 (I think). This was just as surprisingly good as the Enigma I had prior. Light, clear orange color, decent wispy head and some lacing up the sides of the wine glass (Im a connoisseur after all). Smells like a great wild ale, woody sort of, funk, fruit, easily distinguished from a true lambic but still impressive. Taste was even better, funk, sour, barrel, wood, just really tasty. I need more of this for sure.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-12-2011 03:28:33

Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of fruit, candy, cranberry, sugar and spicy notes. Light sweet flavour, light sour touch, somewhat funky, cranberry and red berries. Sour fruity finish, apple and cranberry.
It still feels very fresh, even though it is an aged bottle. Nice and pleasant, not feeling like a lambic (it doesnt need to be) but a fine sour ale.
(1234, I do like Feist. From 33cL bottle shared @ ZZT V. Thumbprint series. Obtained through trade with atxdelivery. Thanks!!)

Refrigerated 12 oz. bottle from FlandersNed poured into a white wine glass.  Pours translucent amber with red hue.  Little lacing, medium body, low carbonation, and light cranberry aroma and some oak.  Taste is nice tart cranberry.  I bet this would be even better fresher.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Rose in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of old roses, wet earth, and sherry. Sweetish on the palate with some mild funk and tart fruit. The overall impression is that its still kinda flabby in spite of its age. We tried this beer when it first came out, and felt the same albeit with fresher fruit. Had hoped that age would increase the acidity, but it only oxidized it. Such a shame as, as I love sour beer and cranberries.

April 16th, 2011 - The capital R next to beers Ive loved and enjoyed is always a sad sight. Dusty bottles of the stuff may be aging in far-flung basements, but in the here and now, its unlikely Ill ever see that beer again. Its not unlike saying goodbye to an old friend, with a kind of permanence that is rare in todays connected world. Outside of death, its a rare feeling for my generation. So, Ratebeers R makes me unusually maudlin when I see it, and even more so when I see it pinned to a great brew, like the New Glarus Cran-bic. White head with a pink blush, and a fox-orange body with some pink hues at its core, its a pretty beer, all gussied up for the ball. The sharp smell of cranberry, true to the beers name, defines the character of the bouquet, but doest monopolize it. A shot of cherry can be found, too, and the sweet smell of strawberry preserves. The flavor, like a Tolkein dwarf, is short and fuzzy, and less like a Tolkein dwarf, watery with a refreshing aftertaste. Its the perfect balance of fruity sugars and a kiss of cranberry, with a tight, crisp aftertaste and overall refreshing quality. Yet it remains a shame that as the new harvests of cranberries come in, there will not be a new batch of Cran-bic out.
Light hazy, off white head. Spices, apricot, farm, some yeast. Light funk in the taste, well developed. Smooth sweetness to go with it. Very nice, fresh yet rich and not thin bodied. Nice. (At ZZT V)
33cl bottle @ ZZT V. Hazy orange color, off-white head. Smell mint, cranberries. Taste lightly sourish, apple, pear, cranberries. Low body, low to medium carbonation.
@ZZT V. Hazy orange colour with no head. Smells mint, dusty, sour fruits. Tastes sweet, fruity, wood. Medium to full body, soft carbo.

Almost 3 years old, this added beauty with age. Reddish brown, with some spider lace, and only the faintest head.  Pleasant berry aroma.  Smooth mouth feel, with some acidic bite.  Very drinkable.  Thanks for hooking me up, FlandersNed.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber orange with a tiny ring of crisp white head. Aroma of sour fruits, cranberry, cherry, red wine, wood, funk. Flavour is beautiful. Slight tartness, well blended together - not predominantly sour. Above mentioned flavours. Sweet, light, crisp, refreshing. Very drinkable indeed!

12 oz. bottle, sent from doobliebop (thanks a lot, Ryan), pours a hazy golden with a small ring of head. Aroma of quite tart cranberries, with some woody red wine tannins, and oak barrels. Flavour is quite a bit sweeter than the nose suggests (as there was no hint of sweetness at all), featuring an assortment of different berries (I get strawberries, cranberries, raspberries, some lychee), followed by oak barrels, and some slight tartness probably from the cranberries. Medium-to-high carbonation and actually tastes like quite a bigger beer (more like 8-9%). Finishes with notes of oak and candied sugar. Very enjoyable, unique fruit beer.

Red colored and clear, this beer smells of cranberries and wood, with a slight mustiness about it.

The beer tastes sweet, though not nearly as much so as Wisconsin Belgian Red or Raspberry Tart. The sourness and tartness of the cranberries does come forth, but to my disappointment, is overwhelmed by the cloying sweetness that lurks in every New Glarus fruit beer. The sweet / sour dance of Cran-bic never quite seems to find a happy equilibrium.

This was a fun beer to drink, but ultimately, I would really like to see New Glarus produce a few beers that gravitated more toward traditional fruit lambics, with a strong sour presence.

6/29/12. 12oz bottle with big thanks to stevencon! Holy crap, I wish I had bought a case of this when I was in WI! Clear golden pour with a small khaki head. Lovely aroma of oak, vanilla, butterscotch, funk, and fruitiness. Lovely tart fruity flavor of cherry and cranberry loaded with vanilla and touches of oak. Shit this is awesome!

27th June 2010Clear amber beer. Bubbly white head. Crispy palate, semi dry. Sweet cranberry that is really very well balanced with  lemony sourness. Every mouthfeel is a sweet and sour contradictory treat. Finishes soft with sweetness just coming out on top. As it should! Great stuff!

Bottle pours a pink orange small head. Tastes smells of cranberry sweet bitter tart. Had a bitter finish started sweet and nice bit creamy then nasty funky finish. Not great not bad. Let three people try it all hated the finish.

No idea what vintage this is, but it is from the thumbprint series rather than the unplugged label. 12 oz red foil wrapped bottle into a tulip glass.

A - Slightly hazy dark orange body. Has an almost peach hue to it out of the light. One finger off white head formed initially. Settles down to some soapy edging with a ton of lacing and retention. 

S - Tart cherries and cranberries. Smooth mixture of oak, vanilla, and funky brett. This is the pleasant form of the dirty sock aroma. 

T - Tart and sour cranberry juice initially. This is followed by barrel notes of vanilla and oak. The finish is yeasty with a bit of spice and cinnamon. Funky notes linger around with the mouth puckering tartness. Mouth feel is spritzy and medium bodied, almost syrupy. 

O - New Glarus makes some of the best fruit beers in America in my opinion. This is an awesome cranberry wild ale. Really tart and refreshing. I wish I had access to this stuff.
From the bottle. Musty fruit aroma, good balance of sweet and sour. Really lingers on the palate, good carbonation and mouth feel. I get some wood, slight funk and  fruit..

Originally reviewed: 12/25/09. Grabbed a bottle of this during my visit to WI. Pours a murky reddish hue with no head at all. Tiniest bit of lace sticks to the glass. Scents of cranberry, leather, and hay.

Nice crisp body to this beer. Light carbonation on the tongue. Flavors of tart cranberries, green apples, barn funk, and a touch of wood on the finish. This was really good. Its not a style that I can drink much of, but this was really well-made. Nice work, NG!

Damn, I got a couple of these as extras so thought I would share those and send them onto others I knew hadnt tried them. Now I wish I would have kept for myself whuahaha. Bready, tart, berry/fruit in the nose. Acidic palate but with a sweet finish. Pretty clean, some cough drop cherries in there.

Poured pinkish and golden.  Aroma was amazing.  Tart, sweet, cranberries, funk...mmmm...Taste was ok.  Sweet cranberries up front to sour funk then tart on the back end.  Not so balanced.  Sweet, sour, tart, that order.  Enjoyable, and thankful for the bottle juice.
12 oz bottle, shared with Pat. Pours cloudy amber.  Aroma is musty with buttery oak.  Flavor is tart but not over the top, oak, vanilla.  Sweetness plays well with the tart.

12 oz. bottle shared by shigadeyo.  Pours a pinkish amber color with a smaller bubbly light pink/off white head.  The aroma has a crazy amount of berries, tart, sweet and moderately acidic, I cant wait for the first taste.  Additional notes of citrus and some spices that were a bit of a surprise.  The flavor has plenty of cranberry character, but also a good amount of cherry.  Sweet, tart and acidic with some subtle spices thrown in.  Noticeable carbonation.  This was a treat!

Poured a hazy, yet glowing golden orange. Very small head that disappeared quickly. Smells of cranberries, tart, slight yeast, and a little funk. Starts out semi-sweet and tart, nice creamy mouthfeel, and a moderately tart/sour finish. I wasnt getting much of the cranberries at first, but as it warmed they became much more apparent. Very nice sour and what a great value. Delicious, pour me another glass please.

Pours out a pink tinged light orange with plentiful white foam that settles down quickly.  Tart cranberries a hint of apple vinegar and a bready malt on the nose.  Its a subtle and pleasing aroma.  Taste is initially apple vinegar, but after a sip or two the cranberries show up.  Its tart, bordering on the edge of sour and finishes with a blend of vitamin C and apples.  Quite refreshing.  Palate is nice - crisp, dry, somewhat high carbonation.  Seek this one out.  Its delicious!

Pours a ruddy golden color with some hints of a head around the edges of the glass. Aroma is absolutely fantastic and alluring!  Funk, hints of barnyard, some cheesy notes, but all with a beautiful fruity note - this is pristine!  Oh, wait, I actually have to drink this to fully rate it?  Incredible combination of raspberry/cranberry/tart fruit and the sourness one would expect.  There is a sweetness to this that complements the tartness/sour nature of this brew - again, amazing.  Palate is just about right - medium to borderline full for the style and just the right amount of carbonation.  Sweet on the palate, lasts with a residual dryness.  Came into this with high hopes, and left stunned - great beer!

From notes.  First reviewed 8/29/2011.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip. 2011 batch.

Cran-bic has an amber cherry color with a tint of peach when the light hits the glass right. The bubbles of a medium white cap pop and fade fairly quickly, but there is some lace left behind.

Cranberry is the most prominent in the nose, but there a few other aromas here. A light, sweet aroma is not identifiable but definitely there. Some spicy woody notes are there as well.

Up front the flavor is fairly sweet. The flavor does impart a nice tartness, although the cranberries do not contribute a very robust flavor. It tastes almost like cherries or green apples as well. There is a light spicy oak flavor and a little vanilla toward the end, and the finish is a slightly sour general fruitiness.

The carbonation is crisp, almost fizzy, and cuts through the flavor of each sip to keep the tongue fresh. Accompanying the sweetness up front is a tart juiciness that turns lightly dry by the end. A buttery oakiness in noticeable in the middle. The body is on the light side of medium.

This is sweeter than I would have expected, especially since cranberries are tart to begin with. I found it easy to drink and could easily have a few more bottles.

I cant remember if I have had this one before so figured I would review a bottle from last year. Poured a clearish orange color, with no lacing or head. Aroma is a mix of rasp tart and belgian red, with more woody flavors, and extra sourness from the cranberry. There was also some subtle vanilla spice in the nose. Taste is a perfectly balanced sour lambic with one of the softest mouths you can encounter. Excellent beer from the Legends of fruit based brews.

Cranic pours a mixture of light red and amber.  Really a beautiful color that you can see in the pic.  A small head forms but quickly fizzes away like a champagne.  First thing I noticed in the smell is a light fresh dose of Cranberries.  Mixed in their is a small amount of acidity and tartness that makes your nose sting just a tad.  In the end is a hint of malt and oak.  Its just a very light smelling beer.  Heck if you can even call it a beer.  To me its more like a mixture of a beer and wine.

The taste came in three parts for me.  The first part was definitely tart and slightly funky on the palette.  As the ale hits the middle of your mouth it starts getting richer.  The cranberries start to really come in.  Mix that in with the oak and its a nice rich deep taste.  Then in the end the tartness comes back a tad mixed in with some bitterness.  Just a beautiful beer.  Mouthfeel is on the lighter side with the perfect amount of carbonation.  Just a joy to drink.

Bottle pours golden color with a thin white head that disappears.  The aroma is tremendous with notes of oak, sour fruit, and sweetness.  Taste is malty with sour notes and a nice sweetness to back it up.  Tart then sweet.  The oak is also noticeable providing wood and vanilla flavors.  Body is medium with a sweet finish.  Overall, a delicious brew that is welcome in my fridge anytime.

Bottle. Strong, sour cherry aroma. Clear reddish orange body. Scant head ring. Sweet and sour on the tongue, more sour than sweet. Again, more cherry than cranberry which is maybe a good thing despite the fact Im not a huge cherry fan. Very good sour lambic.

12 oz bottle shared by Pineypower, thanks Dean. Poured a clear body of burnt orange but as the light moves through the glass there are flashes of red, sadly there was hardly any head at all. Aroma was sour, notes of cranberry juice, band aid, medicine and some saw dust. Acidic body with light crisp carbonation, and a lingering sour flavor on the finish. Flavor of vinegar, cranberry juice, and a slight hint of copper. Nicely done, great beer.
I enjoy this above the Cherry and Raspberry offerings.  I see it as occupying a middle ground between the two,Not as tart as Rasp, not as complex-sweet as the Cherry.  Just perfect in fact!
Why wouldnt this beer be good. Great soft sour cranberry nose....tart and refreshing. Mouthfeel is wonderful, and has awesome cranberry flavors with a tartness thats not to sour or drying.

Bottle courtesy of Daknole!  Pours a nice ruby red color.  Aroma is tart cranberries with some interesting funk and berry sweetness.  Taste is medium sweet and medium tart and really nice.  Fantastic beer and Im glad I got to try it.

12oz bottle thanks to daknole, ok this is ridiculous. Creme de menthe on nose. This Wisconsinites are the Iron Chefs of Fruit Beers. Huge cranberry nose, big tartness, ginormous fruit flavor, This is epic. NOICE!
Thanks daknole! This beer poured a very carbonated rose color. Soft sweet and fruity. Bubbly andI delicious
Poured a light amber color and had a great scent of cranberries. However the taste was not pleasant to me, was very tart and just seemed off for my liking.

Bottle from 2011.  Pours orange with a light haze and a thin head.  Tart acidic and floral aromas.  Spritzy carbonation with a medium body.   The carbonation reminds me of partially fermented fruit juice when you leave a bottle of cider in the fridge for too long.  But really its a good thing.  Tart cherry /cranberry flavors - theres a light sweetness thats underneath.  But the spritzy tartness keeps this bright with richer cherry flavors in the finish. I dont particularly get all cranberry more of an assortment mostly cherry and a little apple.  Its tasting really well right now.  Good with everything else cranberry during this time of the season.

Bottle, thanks to Atom. Pours out an interesting light orange color with a rather small white head. Aroma is tart, acidic funk, oak and light sweetness. Taste is nice tart funkiness, good cranberry flavors balance with the funky tartness to give a very nice balance to this beer, light sweetness adds a good compliment. Once again NG hits a home run.

I rather like this stuff. Its a fruity sour ale w/ a ton of aged character. It pours a kind of ugly orange red w/ no head but thats the only thing wrong w/ it. Nose and flavor are super tart cranberry sourness with a thick, nutty barrel character. It all comes together in a way that begs for slow sipping without being too heavy.

Courtesy of northernbrews. Amber, reddish tints, minimal head. Tart cherry up front, (i guess its cranberry). Light dusty/musty character, oak/vanilla. Flavor on par but, much more intense, cranberry/cherry tart, oak/vanilla, sweet cherry through the finish. Reminds me of the belgian red with the cherry aspect. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Very well done.

Pours a light, very clear amber/orange color with a thin pink head...nice lacing!  Aroma has cranberry...more sweet than tart...and some smooth oaky vanilla notes.  Flavor is tart with some sour fruits, nice oaky notes, a hint of vanilla, and some cranberry sweetness.  mouthfeel is light and very lively and the finish lingers with an excellent balance of oaky vanilla and cranberry.  what a great beer!

Rose-tinged orange with a minimal head. Aroma is bursting with cranberries, light wheatiness, and a hint of sour. Palate is about the same. Not my thing. I hate to ding it for taste and overall so much, but I couldnt drink this if I had to.

12oz. Bottle:  Got in trade from changeup45; THANKS Garry!  Aroma of funk, vanilla, oak, light berries, and slight cranberry.  Poured amber in color with a tiny, white head that disappeared except for around the edges.  Hazy.  Lightly sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet and slightly tart.  Tastes of fruit, berries, funk, vanilla, and some cranberries.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Funk, berry, vanilla finish is yummy.

Bottle: &nbsp Amberish in color, slight haze, a little bright, moderate to large fizzy white head, spotty 

lacing. &nbsp Very nice tart fruity nose, barnish, musty, smells like a Lambic. &nbsp Suppose thats where "Cran-bic" 

comes from. &nbsp High hopes for this Fruit Beer. &nbsp Oh lordy! &nbsp Right up there with the Raspberry and Cherry 

beers, this one is also just friggen tasty! &nbsp As you guessed it, Cranberry like flavors up front. &nbsp This is no 

cheap/artificial like flavor, this is the real stuff. &nbsp I just keep nosing this beer, smells so good! &nbsp Tart 

and sweet on the tongue, full of Cranberry flavor. &nbsp Like their other Fruit beers, no idea what the base is, but 

at this point it doesnt matter. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp The flavor lingers for such a long 

time... but I still find myself having to continually sip this one. &nbsp Superb! &nbsp Great balance between sweet, 

sour, fruitiness, and mustiness. &nbsp Thanks Bob for this gem!

Huge thanks to brian23456 for sending this as an extra in a recent trade!

Pours a dark rosé color with golden orange hues and a one finger, frothy white head that quickly settles into a lasting ring. Sporadic streaks of lacing left behind. 

Earthy, slightly funky aroma with a strong barrel presence and prominent fruit presence. Lots of earthy oak in the nose with musty funk and a ton of cranberry. The dry, tart character of the cranberry is complimented really nicely by the toasted oak and funky bugs. Like other NG fruit beers, the fruit is very prominent in the nose but it doesnt overpower the other characteristics. 

Medium bodied with a slight creamy texture as well as a bone dry, tart mouthfeel. Dry and funky with lots of tart cranberry sweetness thats puckering without being harsh or acidic. Theres also a strong oak presence that compliments the dryness of the fruit and the musty funk. The fruit character dominates giving the beer more of a dry sweetness than acetic sourness. There is some lingering vinegar-y sourness in the finish but it never becomes overly harsh or unpleasant. 

Overall this was an interesting experiment that paid off. The cranberries worked really well in this hybrid fruit/sour beer because of their natural tart and dry flavor. If you enjoy cranberries than you will probably love this beer. If not, I suggest that you skip trying this beer altogether.
Sampled at an esbls tasting.  From Joe. G.  Clear with no head and no carbonation to be seen.  A cranberry nose with funkiness.  The flavoris big cranberry with yeast, and funk.  This is very tasty.
Appears a light pink to orange. Had a nice funk to the nose, some tart fruit. Taste is very tart at the end. Good carbonation bite. Overall, interesting and glad to have tried it.

Bottle from shigadeyo. Poured clear reddish color an average fizzy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Medium to heavy cranberry sour fruit aroma. Medium to full body with a tingly texture and soft carbonation. Solid complex dark fruity flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Standout drinkable fruit beer.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours reddish copper with a miniscule off-white head and a sour fruity aroma. There is a powerful sweetart cranberry flavor supported by a sturdy malt base. It does taste like a lambic, even though not traditional. Very nice.

Bottle as the Cran-Bic from Guerde. Thanks a whole bunch guy. Pours reddish orane tinged gold with a vianishing head. Aroma of lightly sour berry. Near med body. Flavor is mildly sour berry and a little, very little, malt. Finishes quite sweet/tart. Brilliant.

Bottle (trade with arkurzynski - thanks).  Musty, sour lemon malt and cranberry aroma.  Slightly hazy pale ruby red color with moderate head.  Sweet-tart cranberry and malt flavor.  Spectacular blending of sweet and sour flavors.   Delicious.

Pours a clear copper with a rosey hue. Very light head that once poured disappears. Aroma is tart notes (carnberry present). Earthy notes of dried leaves, brown sugar and raisin. Earthy notes of oak definitely there. Flavor is tart. Mix of floral notes with strong cranberry. Notes of vanilla and raisin. Body is light with a syrupy touch and active carbonation.
Great champagne color with a rosy tint, ssweet aroma, flavor.crisp raspberry and tat cranberry.

12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter.  clear reddish gold with minimal head and little lacing.  aroma of cranberries, oak and slight funk.  taste is cranberries, some vanilla, slightly acidic with some tart cherries.  low to medium carbonation and a bit on the dry side.  very well done fruit beer!

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2015 Bottle. Reddish pink pour with an initial pinkish-white head that quickly dissipates to almost nothing. Sweet nose of cranberry, but also a bit sour. Medium palate. Taste is sweet fruit, aggressive tart cranberry, but a nice soft finish. Excellent brew.

Bottle. 12 oz. Split with James and Bear Juden. Almost had a sip at Capones, but James stole it. Pours a light orange-pinkinsh hue with a spottily bubbled head. Aroma of sharp funky cheddar cheese initially, then cranberries, graham cracker crust, tart cherries, and some slight vanilla. Tastes very much like a tarter, more bitter Enigma. Very good, but cant touch his big brother, Enigma.

Bottle. Pours a pink tinted clear with a light head. Aroma is slightly musty with dry fruity wine characteristics. Taste is very light and poppy. Sweet berry fruits are apparent with a slightly tart finish. Very crisp and enjoyable.

Light golden pour with a pinkish tint and a foamy white head.  Aroma of cranberries and sour funkiness.  Flavor of cranberry sweetness up front with a tart sour finish.  Light bodied and highly effervescent mouthfeel.  Nice ... a bit sweet for my tastes but well crafted none the less.

12 oz. bottle from somewhere.

Ar: Musky, a little bit of barnyardishness, fresh berries.  
Ap:  Pours a crystal clear light pink with a small champagne-like head.
T:  Crisp, tart cranberry flavors are very well balanced with some great mustiness.  Just great balance here, the finish is nicely tart.
P:  Thinner body with champagne-like carbonation.

O:  Just a spectacular offering from New Glarus.  I was lucky to find the last bottle of this in my parents fridge.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2012 Bottle with Brendan and streets. Pours an amber body with fluffy white head. Aroma is musky, dusty, sstrawberries, and cranberries. Mouthfeel is is soft with fruity notes. Perfect relaxing fruit.

12-oz bottle courtesy of James at his apt. Shared w James and Streets. Drank from fluted glass. Pours amber with soft, fluffy white head. Bubbles visibly rising from bottom of the glass. Aroma is intense fruits and spice and I automatically thought of Christmas for some reason. Maybe its the muskiness making me think of relatives houses and old times. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. The cranberry and strawberry are dominating. Pretty tart but not sour. Medium to high carbonation. One of the best fruit beers I have ever tried.

Bottle courtesy of Atom. Pours pink tangerine with minimal head. Aroma of the tart cranberries tempered with barrel notes of oak. Tart lovely flavor balanced with just enough sweetness to counter the acidity. Easy to drink palate makes this a terrific fruit beer....Id expect nothing less from this outfit.

Sour notes and wood and some funk on nose.  Beautiful reddish peach orange with low carbonation.  No head or lacing.  Super bright acid, mouthwatering-absolutely delicious.  Great cranberry flavors and oak.  Some lingering red berry sweetness.  Would be great with a watermelon and basil salad or soft creamy cheese or anything pinot-friendly.
Bottled. An amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt as well as ligter notes of berries. The flavor is acidic with notes of malt and cranberries, leading to a tart finish.

pours a pale rose with a very thin white head an no lacing.  sweet aroma of apples and cranberry.  Taste is both sweet and sour with strong cranberry notes as well as more floral qualities.  finish is tart and crisp.

12 oz bottle from fear025. Pours clear amber with a small foamy off white head. Aroma of tart fruit including cranberries and cherries, graham crackers with some caramel and oak. The flavor is slightly tart cranberry, rich graham cracker malt and finishes with a light acidic wild taste. Medium body with average carbonation and a smooth, creamy mouth feel. Another amazing fruit beer from New Glarus, the fruit and malt are perfectly balanced and tastes like a dessert without being sweet.

Bottle. Pours clear blushy red with a quick white tight head. Aroma is tart and fruity with some yeast mixed in. Taste is sweet tart and sour all at once with a well balanced raspberry and cranberries, and also shows malt and yeast and acidicticy. Palate is thin and slick which finishes dry. Really liked this one!
Ten once snifter,probably more than need. Very cranberry flavor, lambic character not so notable.

Bottle from Breeze Thru.  Pours a reddish orange with a white head, great lacing.  Aroma is tart sweet fruits (cranberry, cherry) and wood.  Taste is sour cranberry, sweet berry, some malt, some earthiness.  Has a woody pine layer.  A bit "juice"y with muted carbonation.  Nicely light with a lot of character.

Pours a crystal clear blush color with barely any head.  Aroma is bursting with fruit.  Wonderful taste.  Basically sparkling cranberry juice.  Tart, sour, refreshing, light.  Flavors of apple, cranberry and lemon.  Some wheaty-malt undertones.  This is light enough to be a great summer quencher and its also festive and tart enough to be a great holiday treat.  Very well done...New Glarus does fruit beers like no other.

Aroma: cranberry, slightly earthy, moderately tart with a balancing sweet aroma as well.  Pours a rusty red-orange, faint head dissipates quickly and leaves minimal lacing.  Nice tart cranberry flavor, sourness is mellowed out slightly by some residual sweetness, a bit funky and earthy, some oak.  Light-medium body, fairly high carbonation.

Purchased at Breeze Thru Liquors in Milwaukee, WI; enjoyed on one of the last meteorological nights of the summer after making replacement keys for my lady, only to find the lost keys within 2 minutes of getting home.  Appearance is like carbonated juice, ruby red with light brown hues, slightly cloudy, no head at all, tiny carbonation bubbles rising to the top.  Aroma of vinegar, sour, cranberries, slight oak, some previous reviews state it smells like horseblanket, and I have no idea what that is so I Googled it, and Im not sure if its a real word.  Is that some descriptor that fancy beer raters just came up with to sound smarter, or is it an actual thing?  Anyways, I think it smells rather nice.  Taste is definitely sour, the sourness doesnt dominate but it does linger, along with a nice cranberry juice flavor that adds a very subtle bitterness to it and a touch of sweetness.  Light to medium body, medium to high carbonation.  Soda like quality to it but you can tell its still beer.  Tastes like the blanket of 10,000 horses.  I enjoyed it.

kind of surprised to see this rated as a fruit beer. It tastes to me (and the name implies) like a Lambic. Pours a light almost rose red with a fizzy white head. Nose and taste is of cranberries and wild yeast. Very tart from start to finish. Missed out on the second batch, but the original was great and held up well.

(12oz bottle from Nuplastikk!).  Pours a cloudy pink-ish color iwht off-white head that leaves some nice lacing.  Aroma is funk, cranberries and some wood.  Taste is sweet with some tartness all the way through.  Full bodied with a sticky texture.  Smooth, tart finish.  Really nice.  Wow, a tart beer in a 12oz bottle.  What a concept!
Bottle. Clear golden body with a small white head. Aroma and flavor is cranberries, tartness and sweet fruit.

Appearance is like a rose wine with a 1 finger fluffy pinkish head, visible effervescence, great head retention.  Aroma is oak barrel, tart/funky cranberries, brettanomyces, and hay.  Taste is whisky oak, distinct cranberry fruit flavor, tartness, wheat malt.  Body is medium, perfectly viscous, lively cabonation, and a dry finish.  Overall, very very good Wisconsin interpretaton of a fruit lambic.  Delightful to enjoy on the dock of a bay with tall northwood pines all around!

Pours lively red/orange with intense notes of banana/cloves and tart cranberries.  quite lively on the palate, the yeast melds nicely with the tart cranberries and it offers a nuanced dancing finish.  One word....Intense.

Pours a copper/red hue with a very small off white head that dissapates completely.  Aroma of belgian yeast, cranberries and a touch of funk.  Taste is sour leading to a tart green apple or crabapple finish.  Pucker up!  Gets a little sweet at the end, but still great.

355ml bottle from jsprime. clear red witha pinkish head. tart cranberry juice aroma. beautiful clean slightly sour, light golden ale with the addition of just the right amount of fruit character. another masterful fruit beer from Dan Carey.

bottle-pours bright orange/red in the dark hue with a sprtizy clean white head with a clear body.  nose is so wonderful-wood, funk, vanilla, berries, its a little more funky than the other fruit beers they make but has the similarties.  flavors of funk, wood, sharp berries, vanilla-wonderful.  words are hard to describe here but there are so many subtle nuances with this beer.  body has sharp but not overly carbonated.  long zippy tingly finish of oak, vanilla, and cranberries.  this beer is truely one of a kind and i SO WISH i bought more of this stuff.  could be my favorate NG beer to date!  WONDERFUL!

Pours a beautiful pale strawberry with a slightly off-white pinkish head which doesnt hang around long. I could smell te Brett funk when I poured it. Lemons, tart cherries, barn funk, sweet fruits and lemons in the nose along with just some slight sweetness. Flavor is fruity and funk up front then quickly fades to a nice lemony tartness then gets a little sweet. Velvety mouthfeel. Good beer. the sourest beer Ive had from them yet but why cant try be very sour!? Please make them more sour.
A very nice lambic with a refreshing tartness in its flavor!  Love New Glarus!

12oz bottle thanks to Eric
A:Funk-wild yeast, syrupy sweetness, cranberry, spiced apple, vanilla
T:tart, dry, sweetened cranberries
This is an interesting beer. I would not be opposed to trying it again. I did feel that it lacked the complexity of most highly rated wild fruit beers.

Surprisingly I never rated this from the last time I had it when it was still from the unplugged series.  Newer bottle, from the thumbprint line.  Light pink in color with a small white head.  Has the look of a lighter red wine.  Light cranberry in the aroma, some tartness, and that usual new glarus malt/yeast that I tend to get from their fruit beers.  Taste is cranberry tartness upfront, some caramel, toffee, and cotton candy-like sugar.  Taste is fairly tart.  Slightly thin.  This is a much better version than the unplugged variant.  I would absolutely trade a bottle of this for a bottle of the 3 fonteinen zomer.

Bottle pours a clear, shining pink/orange/red color with a slightly pink head. Aroma is juicy and tart with notes of cranberry bubblicious(if there is such a thing), vanilla, pie crust, cherry, cinnamon, and a touch of funk.  Flavor shows the same with additional notes of oak, lemon, caramel, light florals, and even more cranberry. Overall body is light to moderate, starts somewhat sweet, and finishes with a crisp drying acidity. This stuff is delicious and very easily my favorite NG brew.

12oz bottle pours a clear golden and bubbly pink with a small quickly dissipating white head. Smells like a cranberry cocktail with yeast, spices, and slight vanilla. Wow, cranberries have a great balance of sweet and tart the oak and yeast presence really helps to make this balance perfect with some sourness in the middle. Awesome!

Pour from a bottle after a recent trip to Wisconsin. Light clear and red pink in color. Cranberry aromas off the top. Nice and crisp in your mouth. Flavors are delightful with the fruit and tart sour qualities. In the background the light oak quality comes through and give this beer almost a wine like character. Pretty easy to drink and perfect on a summer day. Liked this beer very much.

So many NG beers Ive had and failed to rate.  Like this one which I had 3-4 back in the Winter of 2009.   This was a pretty solid fruit beer with some hints of tartness and sourness, but nowhere near enough complexity to begin to call it a lambic or even a sour ale.

Bottle courtesy mtjoseph, thanks again Mark! Pours a slightly pink/orange with minimal white head.  The aroma on this is out of this world.  Cranberry, cinnamon, clove.  This is a Christmas candle in a glass!  (and I love Christmas candles)  The taste is slight cranberry with again some cinnamon mixed in to give this a nice flavor balance.  The sourness comes in at the 3/4 mark and you do get a little funk if you let the beer warm a bit.  The mouth feel is a little light but is the only negative with the beer if I can even call it that.  Overall, this is an outstanding fruit beer. Surprise, surprise it is by New Glarus.  Im definitely going to be stock piling a few of these for Thanksgiving/Christmas.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle at RBSG - on the bus? I remember something NG getting opened at our table during the Grand Tasting by our table enabler. Weird pink colour with a thin white dusting. Smells like those Danish cookies in the metal tin at xmas. Soft spices, cranberry or other berry sweetness and slight sourness with a hint of funk. Tastes similar to cranberry cocktail, light herbs, soft spice, bit of wood and some earthiness. Finishes smooth and feels great with the light tartness waking up my mouth.

On tap at Vintage 7/20/11 in Madison, pours a clear light red with a decent off white head, aroma is full of sour funk with cherry, mmmm, I wish I could smell this all day, the flavor has a ncie fruity front with a sour funky finish, wow, this is a special beer, I have to pick up a few 4 packs of this stuff!

Pours brilliant red with a thin white/pink head that disappears quickly leaving a thin ring. Aroma is tart cranberry with cherry, and a nice sour funk. Body is light/medium. Flavor is much the same with the fruit being more pronounced with a nice acidic sour bite. New Glarus continues to amaze me!

Ar: Tart cranberry (surprise!), cherry, and lemon
Ap: Color of a ruby-red grapefruit - clear with a small wisp of a white head and tiny bubbles streaming.
T: Sour, dry cranberry - yet full of juicy berry notes - like a tart fruit-punch - the cranberry is clear, full, and pure - light fruit skin tannins on the finish, long and chalky
P: Medium-high carbonation, very fine bubbles - accentuates dryness and tartness of cranberry and funk.
O: Really a stellar fruit beer - captures the essence of cranberry - any funkiness accentuates, rather than dominates, the central character (aka: the cranberries!) - wonderfully refreshing and quaffable, yet still moderately complex.

12oz. bottle 2011 version. Tart! Small off-white head atop crystal clear red-orange body. Aroma is moderately sweet, cranberry, some lemon, funk. Taste is moderately sweet, cranberry, some funk, lemon. Light-medium body. Excellent...

2011 bottle; can we take this off the retired list? Anyway; pour shares character with the entire new glarus fruit beer line. Its clear,  modest fine bubbled white head, and champagne like carbonation. The coloration is golden amber. The aroma is cranberry, vanilla, and general sweetness. This brew is just fantastic. Its tart, sweet, and only slightly funky. Cranberries, earthy vanilla, oak, and brown sugar. love it.
